intro: Myrsine macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited myrsine, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces distinctive, fleshy, red berries that are an important food source for native birds. Myrsine macrocarpa typically grows in coastal and lowland forest habitats, often forming dense undergrowth. Its leaves are glossy and have a slightly aromatic scent when crushed.
